Reviews.Title: “Good value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Phillip T
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting, and stayed at Homestead Studio in San Diego/ Mission Valley. The room is clean, and remodeled (and somehow it's still smell fresh paint.) Night attendant was friendly though I checked in after midnight. The hotel is close main freeways, shopping, but very quiet. Good value for a short trip in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Don't arrive before 3pm!”
Reviews.Author: John X
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated. Rooms are modern. Kitchen and bath had been updated with granite. My gripe: I know check in is 3pm, but I have never been refused checkin anywhere because it wasn't 3pm on the dot. Most hotels will be accommodating and give you a room or if it's a very busy hotel they will ask you to check back in an hour. NOT this place. It was 12:30 and the woman at the desk didn't even look at the computer. She just said no and to come back after 3. Understand that this is not exactly a booming hotel. It's in a business park and I can assure you there was a room available on a Thursday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at homestead”
Reviews.Author: Alex D
Reviews.Content: The pepole there are very friendly and the manager is one of the nicest people I dealt with. So I strongly recommend people to go there and stay at this hotel. It realy fills like home. :)

Reviews.Title: “Gross!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MKBL999
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disgusting! When I arrived I was given a room on the first floor. When I got to my room I found it to be directly across from one of the trash areas(maybe 4 or 5 feet away). The trash was just dumped under the stairwells, no bins and no covers. There were so many flies swarming that I couldn't get to the door without going through them. The next room they gave me smelled horrid and had urine still on the toilet! The walkway to the room had piles of cigarette buts, litter, and beer cans. I decided to give it one more try and went to a third room. The room stunk of urine so bad I couldn't stand it and hadn't been vacuumed. Needless to stay, I did not even stay a whole night. This place was a dump!! Do NOT be fooled by the " recently renovated" claim they are making. I had several coworkers also stay in this hotel. The complaints were endless. Extremely noisy plumbing, tiny rooms, broken a/c units, broken toilets and showers, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Do Yourself A Favor And Find Another Place!”
Reviews.Author: shauntelle999
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online for a extended stay suite for a family of 4 for 7 days this place was horrible it advertised a spacious "suite" with microwave and kitchenette. We arrived to a extremely small room with a queen size bed and a fold out couch which takes up half of room when pulled out,we couldnt walk around in the room. The sheets were dirty and the microwave was ripped out like it had been stolen.It had none of the other amenities it had claimed to offer. This place was so over priced for what it offered over $110.00 per night. This community didn't feel safe enough for my family.I would suggest checking out the other hotels near hotel circle better deals and more piece of mind.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome... as an absolute last resort”
Reviews.Author: will2002
Reviews.Content: The good things: great location, cheap spacious rooms. The bad: pretty much everything else. The room was booked for me by my employers for a one month stay. If I could have found a room anywhere else for the price, I would have. The rooms only get cleaned once weekly, there is a fee for extra toilet paper and daily towel service, and the beds are extremely uncomfortable. There were no towels in the bathroom when I checked in, a cigarette butt in the coffee mug, and the bathroom was dirty. Oh, there was one other good thing, they had Showtime.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Catira2010
Reviews.Content: This is the filthiest hotel room I have ever seen. The only reason I did not walk back out the door, get a refund, and find other accomodations is that I had worked late and was unable to check in until 10:30 pm. It would have been too late to go elsewhere. Really, this place is a dive - don't stay there. I chose it because I needed a room with a kitchen due to a special diet that required some cooking. Details of the scrunge: I had to get clean blankets from the desk. One of them looked like someone had walked all over it. I don't even want to think about when they last laundered the bed cover. The kitchen floor was so dirty my shoes stuck to it. The microwave had food "explosions" in it. The stove hood was greasy and dusty. The counters had not been wiped down. The sides of the toilet had something running down the sides. Don't want to think about that either. In addition, the interior is very rundown. Rusty towel racks, cabinets defacing, tub drains so slow you are ankle deep in water while showering. When I checked out, I saw a maid in another room "cleaning" the countertops with a broom. Well, that explains a lot. Other issues: I had my first foreboding feeling on my way to my room when I saw an eviction notice on the door of a unit below. Really? The unit next door had a dog that was left alone and barked all day. I never saw a person go to the room. There was dog dookie on the grass outside. Other Extended Stays: The night before, I had stayed at the Extended Stay in Woodland Hills, CA. It was only marginally better. I had hoped it was an exception and Homestead would be better, but it was worse. Homestead Suites Mission Valley appears to be not an extended stay hotel for business and leisure, but a very low rent apartment complex. You would probably do better at a seedy motel. After these two experiences I will never go near anything in the Extended Stay chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: JennLou
Reviews.Content: The staff for this hotel is very helpful, but the bed was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept on. The mattress was very hard and the bed gave way in the middle. The mirror was broken and the curtain rod was hanging unhinged from the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the frugal, but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two weeks during a business trip, and I think it was a great deal. I believe the going rate during my stay was $60 a night for a room with two full beds and a kitchen. The room was big enough that my colleague and I didn't feel cramped; the kitchen and bathroom were functional and sanitary. The hotel has a few outdoor picnic tables (where you can get wi-fi) and a grill, which I saw people using while I was there. The Homestead is situated in an office park, so the immediate surroundings completely lack character but are very quiet (and totally abandoned at night). The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk (or a 2-3 minute drive) from a strip mall with a grocery store, pharmacy, Denny's, Starbucks, etc. It is also very convenient to a lot of other shopping centers and malls, as well as public transportation. Some reviewers mentioned that no one cleaned their room while they were there... It's the hotel's policy to clean each room only once a week during your stay, but you can request new towels/linens more frequently if you want them. (We did.) When I was there, they followed their policy and cleaned our room twice in two weeks. Some other reviewers mentioned traffic noise from the highway, and this might be a concern depending on your room. The hotel buildings are long, with one end very close to the highway and the other further away. I stayed roughly in the middle of my building and had no traffic noise at all in my room, so you would probably be okay as long as you request a room that's not right next to the highway. Overall, if you plan to treat your hotel room as a place to sleep and maybe cook meals, I recommend this hotel. On the other hand, if you want to spend your vacation lounging in your hotel room, this isn't a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “One man's trash is another man's treasure”
Reviews.Author: txpilgrim
Reviews.Content: The Mission Valley area is quite nice with a lot of shopping, grocery stores & restaraunts within 5 minutes of the hotel. The hotel is amoungst a few office building complexes so it's fairly peaceful and safe after 5 pm & on weekends. The rooms are no frills The furnishings aren't contemporary they seemed to be well made, durable & the pieces matched. Also, the rooms are alittle dark; i suggest requesting a corner room as they have more windows. Overall the room was clean. There were a few blemishs on the bathroom floor but they would require more than a mop to remove (scuff marks, etc) so it didn't bother me as much. The AC worked well but the weather was nice & i felt safe enough to open the windows at night. Wireless internet was like $5......for my entire 3 night stay! You must stay at the hotel for a specific number of nights before they'll change your sheets for free but they do offer a paid service. In addition, you can go to the front desk & get new towels on a daily basis. The hotel staff was friendly & helpful. We booked a double room & at check-in they said these rooms are not available but they did supply us with two queen rooms next to each other as an alternative which worked for our sleeping arrangements. The front office closes so if you need something (toilet paper, towels, etc) I suggest getting it early. I stayed at the hotel with a large family group so we had good discounted rates & while it might not have thrilled anyone it satisified the needs of a wide group of people. There's a kitchen in the room so many within the group saved money by buying groceries at 1 of 2 stores near the hotel & cooked. There isn't a play area at the property so some kids might get alittle restless. There wasn't much traffic at the hotel so older kids may pass the time playing in the more remote parking areas (I'm certainly not condoning playing in the street :-)). If you plan on spending a large amount of time in the room I suggest staying at another hotel. All & all it's not a great hotel so I can see how many would not value it but at the same time I think it meets the "safe and germ free" criteria many budget consience travelers would request.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel experience that I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: gdoimye
Reviews.Content: My family came from Phoenix, Az for our one year anniversary and to take our 2 year old son to Sea World and the beach for the first time. This hotel was only 5 miles from Mission Beach and Sea World. It was in the heart of a shopping and dining area, We couldn't of been more please with its location and the type of room that we had. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel needs a lot of improvement.”
Reviews.Author: ncreviews
Reviews.Content: We are actually staying at this hotel now, through the end of the week. We didn't except much, being that it is a cheaper hotel, however, I would highly suggest finding one of the many other hotels in the area and if you plan on spending a longer time in the S.D. area - checking out and calling several locations before booking. Pros: Location - near major shopping, walking distance to grocery store, starbucks, drug store. Only one mile from large malls, borders, target. Large closet Lots of storage room. Cons: The room is not clean - it seems they took great care in cutting costs wherever they could. This includes cleaning the rooms. The rooms are run down and are in desperate need of renovating. There were a few bugs in our room. The kitchen is small and not all that usable. The bathroom is spacious but was not cleaned well. The toilet works some of the time - runs most of the time. There are cigarette burns in the linens, blankets and curtains. There are stains on the sofa, carpets, tile floor. This location seems to be a place that new recruits for the military stay - which would be just fine, but the recruits tend to be up late, smoking and then up early in the morning doing PT IN the parking lot! Maybe this is fine for other people, but when you are on the ground floor, be prepared to be awakened by loud yelling. The wi-fi hardly works, it's running at modem speeds (we checked) We were on the phone with tech support, and they said that it is just a very slow connection, The bed is terrible - very hard, and the sheets do not fit it. They only clean once per week. No fitness or access to fitness facilities. Every thing in the kitchen seems to be out of the 80's and works like that was the last time any thing in it was replaced. Overall - I would definitely recommend staying somewhere else. This hotel needs too many renovations to count, and definitely needs management who pays attention to details and cares about the cleanliness of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but dirty”
Reviews.Author: tyranomike
Reviews.Content: This is a limited service hotel. They replace the sheets/towels only once per week (although you can take towels to the front desk for a refresh), and as far as I could tell, they clean the rooms only once every few years. The bathroom and kitchen floors were filthy -- hairs, dirt, spilled food. Our beadspread had big red splotches on the underside. Yeah, it looked like blood. I took the bedspread to the front desk and he cheerily replaced it, telling me, "Looks like this one had been washed too many times!" It was a bargain ($50/night on hotwire) but you get what you pay for, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY at all COSTS! Not worth even $10/night”
Reviews.Author: Mister_Vacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutley HORRIBLE! We booked our three rooms a month in advance on the hotel website. When we arrived they had changed all our reservations to Queen rooms (which were way to small for three families of four) and our kids slept on the floor for the first night until they could move us into a King room (that we originally reserved). The staff had no idea how to do their job. They did not reimburse anything nor give us a discount for making us stay in the small queen rooms. Once we finally got into the King rooms the stay went OK. As the other users have stated, the rooms are disgusting and the dishes were probably just put back in the cupboards by the previous tenant if used. We would not allow our toddler to crawl on the floor since the first time we allowed it his knees were black within 15 minutes from the dirty floors. Finally after being home for a month a mysterious charge for $44 appears on our bill and their explanation is that they undercharged us the first time. I guess the only word to sum it all up is HORRIBLE! DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room, Clean, NO restaurant, NO fitness room.”
Reviews.Author: ChavSanti
Reviews.Content: This place is a business district of Mission Valley. It's a quiet, safe area. The room is pretty basic. There is a bed, chair and ottoman, 13" TV, ironing board and iron. Has a kitchen with stove, full size frig and microwave. They provide you with a bar of soap and towels. If you stay less than 7 days there is NO free maid service. Basic cleaning, which means, changing sheets and throwing trash will cost and extra $5 for each request. $10 will get you the basic cleaning + vaccumming and dusting. They actually encourage to get your own stuff from the front desk and clean up your own room. I guess this is how they can offer a low rate. Which we didn't mind. I had a queen size bed which was okay. It creeked a little but was comfortable. No central air, instead, a stand alone A/C unit near windows. Worked well but noisy as it cycles on and off. There is NO fitness room and NO pool. If you want some excercise, you can run around the business park which is a bit hilly. The closes gym, I found, was a 24hr Fitness located at the Mission Valley Mall (about 2 miles) There is a also mini-park with BBQ facilities on the grounds of the hotel. The staff was nice and helpful. Front desk is only open from 7AM - 10PM. After that, you are told to call another number for assistance. There is NO restaraunt on site. I suggest you go grocery before arriving. There is some stuff nearby. There's a Ralph's plaza about 1 mile and the Mission Valley Mall is about 2 miles away, Incohoots Western Bar (1.5 miles) and Fashion Valley Mall (high end stuff) is about 3 miles. We would stay again. Not our 1st choice but definetly be a plan B if all other hotels are unavailable. Once again a basic room. I paid $75/ night out the door. (I had a $10 off coupon printed from their website. ) Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: clayyvo
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel last year and was not happy. I then decided to give it another try on my busness trip this year and was very pleased with all the improvements they had made to the hotel and staff. It is under new management and they have made quite a few wonderful changes. The rooms are cleaner and I was happy to see they had new carpet and beds ( the last time the bed was quite lumpy). The management and staff were very friendly and seemed like they really cared about their guests. I would have to give this hotel hats off to all their improvement. I will stay there again next year and will recommend this hotel to everyone. Excellent hotel and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of dirty”
Reviews.Author: Melbuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Homestead for about a week for business. I pretty much echo the sentiment of many other posters about the dirtyness. My bathtub had mold, the floor did not seem clean and I found some random hairs in the sheets that were clearly NOT mine, causing me to wonder how well they'd been washed. Management should really address this issue. It would be a far better hotel if they did. And, although they do have a small kitchen, I found that the kitchens do not contain plates or cups. This seems odd considering they have utensils and other cooking implements. They also have no pool or any other type of recreation. However, it was convienent to several highways, and close to Ralph's and Long's. Overall, I'd say stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Hotwire!”
Reviews.Author: pgwilli
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to any budget minded person who doesn't mind the short drive to the beach. Hotel was CLEAN, had an apartment size refrigerator, two burner stove, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, pots & pans, dishes, glasses, other cooking utensils. There are shops & markets close to this hotel if you like to cook. Staff was friendly and helpful. You need to provide your own shampoo & conditioner. There was also a barbeque area. Our only complaint was the bed wasn't as comfortable as other hotels we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Dirty and Loud”
Reviews.Author: fidlfreek
Reviews.Content: Since I paid $44/night for the room, I guess it was still a good deal. However, the flooring was very dirty, the shower was mildewy, and the whole place smelled like someone had smoked in it (although it was a nonsmoking room). The hotel has a lot of noise from Interstate 5 and the walls are thin. The bed was very uncomfortable with springs in my back and only 2 pillows (no extras in the room). That being said, it was in a good convenient part of town (as long as you have a car) and the kitchen, linens, and fridge were all clean. Stay here only if you can get a good hotwire deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LondonBrixton
Reviews.Content: Hey, this place is cheap and excellent value particularly if you intend to use public transport. The tram is an easy ten minute walk away and you will be in Old Town in five minutes. This place is lacking in atmosphere so don't book this place if you want to hang around the hotel. Book with confidence if you just want to drop your bags and get in amongst it in San Diego. Tip, we booked this hotel for the first night as it is close to Mission Valley and Old Town and hung out there then booked the 500 West (similar price) the second night which is walking distance to the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! We won't come back!”
Reviews.Author: Whatacountry!
Reviews.Content: The attraction for this hotel is the kitchen, but it's just a tiny refrigerator and a tiny stove. No cooking items or dishwasher. The rooms are cleaned just once a week, so the rooms are very dirty, which surprised us considering the hotel is fairly new. If you just want a cheap place to crash at night, this may work. There is no pool or anything to do here, so leave early in the morning, and don't come back until you are ready to go to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Inhospitable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My brother and I were going on a business trip to San Diego and we had requested: two-beds; accessible room, if not available then a room on the parking level would do; but definately away from the noise of the freeway. I called to let them know we were arriving very late around 1am and to remind them of our room requests. The manager was very rude and unhelpful. I asked how long she had worked in the hotel industry and she arrogantly replied 14 years. I studied Management inTourism and was saddened by the decline in professionalism and courtesy and told her that even if we werent able to get two beds as long as the room was on the ground level, it would do, as I am handicapped and all we needed was a good night's rest before our business meetings the next morning. We were given a room on the second level; one queen bed; and facing the freeway! I am handicapped and use a wheelchair to get around and do walk a little with a walker but cannot do stairs. My brother who weighs 54 pounds less than me had to piggy-back me up two flights of stairs! We had to turn the noisy fan on to drown out the freeway noise. Then were rudely awakened at 5 am by the alarm which must've been set by the previous occupant. They had a long narrow window on top of the headboard which shone bright Southern California sunshine upon our faces so woke us up. We were just not meant to get a good nights sleep! The bath tub was GREY! The walls were clean in the bathroom but the inside of the tub was dark grey! The towels had grey stains on them, luckily I had packed a beach towels so we used those. At $124.00 per night, it was the worst place we had ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: autumnbaby9
Reviews.Content: This hotel only cost me about $35 a night, and was in a convient location to the different sights (sea world, zoo). I loved having a kitchen in the room and there is a shopping complex with a grocery store only 5 mins away so we just ate at the hotel rather than paying a fortune of resturants and the parks. The hotel is a little hard to find, but we had no trouble because i got directions off of mapquest before leaving home. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Would definitly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “below par”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are much better places to stay in the area. They only clean the room once every 3 days max. It was not very clean to begin with when we arrived neither. The dishes were already dirty and trash full so we had to take care of this ourselves. We reserved the room online and the rate was not honored when we arrived. Luckily we had printed off our confirmation just in case. They do not provide the regulars like coffee and shampoo in the room. You have to go to the office and ask for them. The good point is that you get the full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jnettes13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from June 25-27, 2004. As other reviewers said, the complex is amid office buildings. So this probably better suited for business travelers than leisure travelers because of the kitchenette. But I felt the room was small for business travelers compared to other suite hotels I've stayed at in the past. There isn't even a desk for a laptop, but they do offer wi-fi for free. We were there for a leisure weekend trip, and it was good enough because we only stayed in the room basically to sleep. There is a strip mall at the bottom of the hill includes a Starbucks, Ralph's and Long's drugs, so it's very convenient. There are 2 malls in the vicinity and Downtown San Diego is about 5-10 minutes away. The hotel is also right off of Hwy 63 and I-8, so we found it very convenient to where we had to go. It was also reasonably priced compared to the downtown hotels. We drove down to San Diego from the Bay area so we had a car to take us around. I didn't notice how public transportation is in the area, so that may be worth researching if you decide to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Room for a High Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mission Valley hotel over Memorial Day weekend. There were several problems with the room including a broken iron, very loud flushing toilet, molded shower curtain, dirty sofa and very thin walls and floor. The staff were very nice but the hotel didn't seem like it was worth the price of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times, and keep coming back. The service is great, and the staff friendly. It is a short walk/drive to a lovely little strip mall with some nice fast food places. The rooms are clean, spacious, and quiet. It feels a little off the beaten track, but I think that is an advantage. It is actually only minutes from shopping, freeway, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: lizzylizzy
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits on a hill among several office buildings but it is quite convenient since a shopping plaza is right downhill. It only takes 10 min walk there for grocery and meals. Our stay of 5 nights was ok except that the sound proof was not good enough to prevent the noise from next door. The hotel staff was ok but not particulary helpful. It has every thing you would expect from Homestead but this is the most expensive Homestead we had ever stayed at - don't know if it is because of the time (around New Year's Day) or the location in San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: Homestead Studio Suites San Diego / Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 7444 Mission Valley Road, San Diego, CA 92108
